I don't understand?
like xp uses ntfs. win98 was fat32. what does linux use?
ext3 normally
But you can use many others. xfs, jfs, reiser4, just not ntfs, and please not fat
ext3
its the most popular. You don't want to mess around with different filesystem the first time.
The cd is not ntfs, and it will work fine
all cd's and dvd's have their own filesystem (not ext3 or ntfs) and work fine in linux

Well, first try the livecd, it won't install anything and will allow you to try out a full ubuntu system
Then if you want to install, i would suggest shrinking the windows partition and installing ubuntu into the free space, and dual booting

how do i configure my iptable?
think about it, would you program your operating system to include DRM?
and why would you want to do that?
iptables is already configured, and you don't need to mess with it. Firewall is up by default.
just click network icon in the top right of the screen and click manual configuration
now, don't make too many changes to the live cd as you'll lose everything if you re-boot.
you'd have to install to keep any changes made
